edu.txstate.hearts.model

Class Achievements

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.txstate.hearts.model.Achievements

  • public class Achievements
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all achievement related activities and the requirements to achieve them. When an achievement has been earned through gameplay, the name of that achievement is placed in a file for that user
    Author:
    Jonathan Shelton

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Achievements(java.lang.String userName)
      This constructor is called when a user is new to the game without an existing achievements file
      Achievements(java.lang.String userName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> passedAchievements)
      This constructor is called when an existing user file has been found in the system.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private boolean BrokenHeart(int score)
      Uses the end game score to determine if the user has satisfied the requirements for the Broken Heart achievement (collected all the heart cards in the game)

      Check for and give the user any earned achievements at the end of each round.

      Get the name of current user file
      private boolean giveAchievement(java.lang.String nameOfAchievement)
      Method checks if user already has passed in achievement, and writes the achievement if it doesn't exist in the user's achievement list.
      boolean HatTrick()
      Method automatically hands the achievement to a user (if not already earned), therefore it MUST be called on the "playerWithHighestValue" after cards have been passed (near the bottom of runTurn() in Hearts.java)
      private void initializeUser()
      Initialize achievements for a user by setting up a list of achievements and srtting them to default false values.

      Sends message to the console that achievement has been earned.

      There are three "achievements" to be earned here, according to the achievementNames list, however, OvershootingTheMoon1 and OvershootingTheMoon2 are "progression" achievements and do not actually count as a full achievement.
      boolean PassingTheBuck(boolean notifyAchievementEarned, java.util.List<Card> cardsToPass)
      Takes in the user's list of cards to pass from the passing mechanism and checks for the requirement to earn this particular achievement (Queen of Spades)

      Uses score at the end of a round to determine if player has earned the specific requirements for the Shooting The Mon achievement (Score of 26 = collected all point value cards which includes all hearts and the queen of spades
      boolean StartTheParty(java.util.List<Card> cardsPlayed)
      Takes the passed in list of cards played on the table to determine if the user started the round (with the Deuce of Clubs).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Achievements

        public Achievements(java.lang.String userName,
            java.util.List<java.lang.String> passedAchievements)
        This constructor is called when an existing user file has been found in the system. It sets any achievements found in the file to true in the local list of achievements.
        Parameters:
        userName -
        passedAchievements -

    • Method Detail

      • initializeUser

        private void initializeUser()
        Initialize achievements for a user by setting up a list of achievements and srtting them to default false values. counterOvershootingTheMoon keeps track of progress toward the overshooting the moon achievement and is set to zero

      • isAchievementEarned

        public boolean isAchievementEarned(java.lang.String nameOfAchievement)
        Check if a particular achievement exists or not
        Parameters:
        nameOfAchievement - name of achievement to be checked
        Returns:
        true or false

      • notifyAchievementEarned

        public void notifyAchievementEarned(java.lang.String achievementName)
        Sends message to the console that achievement has been earned. This method is unable to send a message to the tooltip in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        achievementName - Name of the achievement earned

      • getUserFileName

        public static java.lang.String getUserFileName()
        Get the name of current user file
        Returns:
        the userFileName

      • setUserFileName

        public void setUserFileName(java.lang.String userFileName)
        Set the name of current user file
        Parameters:
        userFileName - the userFileName to set

      • getCounterOvershootingTheMoon

        public int getCounterOvershootingTheMoon()
        Get the current counter for overshooting the moon achievement
        Returns:
        counter for Overshooting The Moon achievement

      • setCounterOvershootingTheMoon

        public void setCounterOvershootingTheMoon(int counterOvershootingTheMoon)
        Set the counter for overshooting the moon achievement
        Parameters:
        counterOvershootingTheMoon - counter for Overshooting The Moon achievement

      • endGameAchievements

        public int endGameAchievements(int score)
        Check for and give the user any earned achievements at the end of each round. The achievements to be checked are those which rely upon user score.
        Parameters:
        score -
        Returns:
        int 0, 1, 2, or 3. Each number corresponds to a certain achievement deemed to be true. 1 = Broken Heart, 2 = Shooting The Moon, 3 = Overshooting The Moon. It is impossible to earn more than one of these achievements at a time.

      • BrokenHeart

        private boolean BrokenHeart(int score)
        Uses the end game score to determine if the user has satisfied the requirements for the Broken Heart achievement (collected all the heart cards in the game)
        Parameters:
        score -
        Returns:

      • ShootingTheMoon

        private boolean ShootingTheMoon(int score)
        Uses score at the end of a round to determine if player has earned the specific requirements for the Shooting The Mon achievement (Score of 26 = collected all point value cards which includes all hearts and the queen of spades
        Parameters:
        score -
        Returns:

      • OvershootingTheMoon

        private boolean OvershootingTheMoon(int score)
        There are three "achievements" to be earned here, according to the achievementNames list, however, OvershootingTheMoon1 and OvershootingTheMoon2 are "progression" achievements and do not actually count as a full achievement. Therefore, this method will only return true when the requirements for OvershootingTheMoon are earned (which includes having both progression "achievements")
        Parameters:
        score -
        Returns:
        true or false, which indicates achievement has been earned.

      • PassingTheBuck

        public boolean PassingTheBuck(boolean notifyAchievementEarned,
                     java.util.List<Card> cardsToPass)
        Takes in the user's list of cards to pass from the passing mechanism and checks for the requirement to earn this particular achievement (Queen of Spades)
        Parameters:
        score -
        notifyAchievementEarned -
        cardsToPass -
        Returns:

      • StartTheParty

        public boolean StartTheParty(java.util.List<Card> cardsPlayed)
        Takes the passed in list of cards played on the table to determine if the user started the round (with the Deuce of Clubs).
        Parameters:
        cardsPlayed -

      • HatTrick

        public boolean HatTrick()
        Method automatically hands the achievement to a user (if not already earned), therefore it MUST be called on the "playerWithHighestValue" after cards have been passed (near the bottom of runTurn() in Hearts.java)
        Parameters:
        achievementEarned -
        Returns:

      • giveAchievement

        private boolean giveAchievement(java.lang.String nameOfAchievement)
        Method checks if user already has passed in achievement, and writes the achievement if it doesn't exist in the user's achievement list. Returns true if an achievement was added, false if it doesn't
        Parameters:
        nameOfAchievement -
        Returns:

      • getListOfAchievements

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getListOfAchievements()
        Returns all of a user's earned achievements
        Parameters:
        listOfAchievements -
        Returns:
        Earned achievements
